block.p: Hannah Summers Ross, the daughter of Sarah S. Oldham and David A. Ross, both of Darien, Conn., was married yesterday to Thomas Edward Adelman, a son of Margaret F. Adelman and Dr. Jack Adelman of Somis, Calif. Justice Denise R. Johnson of the Vermont State Supreme Court performed the ceremony at the Inn at the Round Barn Farm in Waitsfield, Vt.

Ms. Ross, 28, is keeping her name. She is to become an associate in October at the Boston law firm of Hill & Barlow. She graduated from Yale University and received a law degree from Harvard University, where she was the editor in chief of The Harvard Women's Law Journal. Until last month she was the clerk to Justice Johnson. Her father teaches social studies and other subjects at Greenwich High School in Connecticut. Her mother is a partner in Rutkin & Oldham, a law firm in Westport, Conn.

The bride is the stepdaughter of Elizabeth H. Ross and James R. Oldham.

Mr. Adelman, 36, is a writer. His novel, ''Palm Tree 13,'' is scheduled to be published next year by Highwater Books. His mother is a tax preparer in Camarillo, Calif., for H&R Block. His father retired as a family practitioner in the free medical clinics of Ventura County, Calif.
